80.text:
In the study of Quranic references to astronomical phenomena related to the constellation Al 'Asiyah:

The stars of Al 'Asiyah are described as being 'scattered' (mufarqaat) and 'clustered' (majma'aat) in the night sky. The 'scattered' stars are those that appear evenly distributed throughout the constellation, while the 'clustered' stars form a distinct group or pattern.

Moreover, it is mentioned that the 'moon' (qamar) is 'changed' (tabdal) on the night of 'Al 'Asiyah. This astronomical event is depicted as the moon appearing to split into two distinct halves or parts in the night sky.

Consequently, in the context of Quranic literature, the astronomical phenomena related to Al 'Asiyah consist of the scattering and clustering of stars, as well as the splitting of the moon.
